00018   #define typeSimple    0
00019   #define typeStructure 1
00020   #define typeFunction 2
00021   #define typeMethod    3

00023   struct BaseType
00024   {
00025     unsigned char id;
00026   };

00028   struct Type : BaseType
00029   {
00030     map<string,pair<long,string> > members;
00031   };

00033   struct Generic : Type
00034   {
00035     vector<string> arguments;
00036     Form* code;
00037     map<string,map<string, pair<long,string> > > specializations;
00038     vector<Form*> methods;
00039   };

00041   vector<string> CoreTypes;
00042   map<string,Type> BasicTypes;
00043   vector<pair<string,Generic> > Generics;

00045   bool isInteger(string in)
00046   {
00047     return ((in[0] == 'i') && (1 < from_string<long>(string(in,1,in.length()-1)) < (pow(2,23)-1)));
00048   }
00049   
00050   bool isCoreType(string in)
00051   {
00052     if(isInteger(in))
00053       return true;
00054     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < CoreTypes.size(); i++)
00055     {
00056       if(CoreTypes[i] == in)
00057         return true;
00058     }
00059     return false;
00060   }
00061   
00062   bool isArgument(Form* in, map<string,Form*> arguments)
00063   {
00064     if(isatom(in))
00065     {
00066       map<string,Form*>::iterator seeker = arguments.find(val(in));
00067       if(seeker != arguments.end())
00068         return true;
00069       return false;      
00070     }
00071     error("isArgument must be given an atom, but a list was given.",at(in));
00072   }
00073   
00074   Form* editForm(Form* in, map<string,Form*> replacements)
00075   {
00076     if(in == NULL)
00077       return NULL;
00078     else if(islist(in))
00079     {
00080       Form* out;
00081       out = editForm(car(in),replacements);
00082       in = cdr(in);
00083       if(in == NULL)
00084       {
00085         out = cons(out,NULL);
00086       }
00087       else
00088       {
00089         while(in != NULL && islist(in))
00090         {
00091           out = append((isatom(out) ? cons(out,NULL) : out),
00092                       (isatom(car(in)) ? cons(editForm(car(in),replacements),NULL) : cons(editForm(car(in),replacements),NULL)));
00093           in = cdr(in);
00094         }
00095       }
00096       return out;
00097     }
00098     else
00099     {
00100       if(isArgument(in,replacements))
00101       {
00102         map<string,Form*>::iterator seeker = replacements.find(val(in));
00103         return seeker->second;
00104       }
00105       else
00106         return in;
00107     }
00108   }
00109   
00110   string specializeType(Generic* in, map<string,Form*> replacements, string signature)
00111   {
00112     errormode = GenericError;
00113     Form* specialization_code = editForm(in->code, replacements);
00114     string out = signature + " = type { ";
00115     string type;
00116     for(unsigned long i = 0; i < length(cdr(cdr(specialization_code))); i++)
00117     {
00118       type = printTypeSignature(cadr(nth(cdr(cdr(specialization_code)),i)));
00119       in->specializations[signature][val(car(nth(cdr(cdr(specialization_code)),i)))] = pair<int,string>(i,type);
00120       out += type + ",";
00121     }
00122     out = cutlast(out)+" }\n";
00123     //Specialize methods
00124     for(unsigned long i = 0; i < in->methods.size(); i++)
00125     {
00126       out += "\n" + emitCode(editForm(in->methods[i],replacements));
00127     }
00128     //Return the code for the specialization
00129     reseterror();
00130     return out;
00131   }
00132   
00133   string printTypeSignature(Form* form)
00134   {
00135     if(form == NULL)
00136     { Unwind(); }
00137     else if(isatom(form))
00138     {
00139       string tmp = val(form);
00140       if(isCoreType(tmp))
00141       {
00142         return tmp;
00143       }
00144       else
00145       {
00146         map<string,Type>::iterator seeker = BasicTypes.find(tmp);
00147         if(seeker != BasicTypes.end())
00148         {
00149           return "%" + tmp;
00150         }
00151         else
00152         {
00153           error("Came across an unknown type: '",tmp,"'.",at(form));
00154         }
00155       }
00156     }
00157     else if(islist(form))
00158     {
00159       if(islist(car(form)))
00160         error("The name of a Generic type must be a symbolic atom, not a list.",at(form));
00161       string type_name = val(car(form));
00162       if(type_name == "pointer")
00163       {
00164         return printTypeSignature(cadr(form))+"*";
00165       }
00166       for(unsigned long i = 0; i < Generics.size(); i++)
00167       {
00168         if((Generics[i].first == type_name) && (Generics[i].second.id == typeStructure))
00169         {
00170           if(Generics[i].second.arguments.size() != length(form)-1)
00171           {
00172             error("Wrong number of arguments to specialize the Generic '",
00173                   type_name,"'.",to_string<long>(Generics[i].second.arguments.size()),
00174                   " are required, but ",to_string<unsigned long>(length(form)-1)," were given.",at(form));
00175           }
00176           else
00177           {
00178             string signature = "%" + type_name + "_";
00179             unsigned long j = 1;
00180             for(; j < length(form); j++)
00181             {
00182               signature += printTypeSignature(nth(form,j)) + "_";
00183             }
00184             signature = cutlast(signature);
00185             for(map<string,map<string, pair<long,string> > >::iterator seeker = Generics[i].second.specializations.begin();
00186                 seeker != Generics[i].second.specializations.end(); seeker++)
00187             { 
00188               if(seeker->first == signature)
00189                 return signature;
00190             }
00191             map<string,Form*> replacements;
00192             for(j = 0; j < Generics[i].second.arguments.size(); j++)
00193             {
00194               replacements[Generics[i].second.arguments[j]] = nth(form,j+1);
00195             }
00196             for(j = 0; j < signature.length(); j++)
00197             {
00198               if(signature[j] == '*')
00199               {
00200                 signature.replace(j,3,"ptr");
00201               }
00202             }
00203             push(specializeType(&(Generics[i].second),replacements,signature));
00204             return signature;
00205           }
00206         }
00207       }
00208       error("An unknown Generic type, '",type_name,"' was provided for specialization.",
00209             at(form));
00210     }
00211   }
00212   
00213   bool checkTypeExistence(string name)
00214   {
00215     return ((BasicTypes.find(name) != BasicTypes.end()) ? true : false);
00216   }
00217   
00218   string makeType(Form* in)
00219   {
00220     Type tmp;
00221     tmp.id = typeSimple;
00222     if(length(in) != 3)
00223     {
00224       error("(type) takes exactly 3 arguments. ",to_string<long>(length(in)),
00225             " were given.",at(in));
00226     }
00227     if(isatom(cadr(in)))
00228     {
00229       if(analyze(val(cadr(in))) != Symbol)
00230       {
00231         printf("ERROR: Type name is a non-symbolic atom.");
00232         Unwind();
00233       }
00234     }
00235     string name = val(nth(in,1));
00236     if(checkTypeExistence(name))
00237     {
00238       printf("ERROR: Type already exists.");
00239       Unwind();
00240     }
00241     BasicTypes[name] = tmp;
00242     string type = printTypeSignature(nth(in,2));
00243     return "%"+ name + " = type " + type;
00244   }
00245   
00246   void validateStructure(Form* in)
00247   {
00248     if(length(in) < 3)
00249     {
00250       printf("ERROR: Wrong number of arguments to (structure).");
00251       Unwind();
00252     }
00253     if(isatom(cadr(in)))
00254     {
00255       if(analyze(val(cadr(in))) != Symbol)
00256       {
00257         printf("ERROR: Structure name is a non-symbolic atom.");
00258         Unwind();
00259       }
00260     }
00261   }
00262   
00263   string makeStructure(Form* in)
00264   {
00265     Type tmp;
00266     tmp.id = typeStructure;
00267     validateStructure(in);
00268     string name = val(nth(in,1));
00269     if(checkTypeExistence(name))
00270     {
00271       printf("ERROR: Type already exists.");
00272       Unwind();
00273     }
00274     for(unsigned long i = 2; i < length(in); i++)
00275     {
00276       Form* current_field = nth(in,i);
00277       if(islist(current_field))
00278       {
00279         if(length(current_field) != 2)
00280         {
00281           printf("ERROR: Structure fields must either be a (name type) pair or a single symbol in case of generic structures");
00282           Unwind();
00283         }
00284         else if(islist(car(current_field)))
00285         {
00286           printf("ERROR: Can't use a list as a field name.");
00287           Unwind();
00288         }
00289         else
00290         {
00291           string field_name = val(car(current_field));
00292           if(analyze(field_name) != Symbol)
00293           {
00294             printf("ERROR: Can't use a non-symbolic atom as a field name.");
00295             Unwind();
00296           }
00297           tmp.members[field_name] = pair<int,string>(i-2,printTypeSignature(cadr(current_field)));
00298         }
00299       }
00300       else
00301       {
00302         printf("ERROR: Structure fields must be lists, not atoms.");
00303         Unwind();
00304       }
00305     }
00306     string out = "%" + name + " = type {";
00307     for(map<string,pair<long,string> >::iterator seeker = tmp.members.begin(); seeker != tmp.members.end(); seeker++)
00308     {
00309       out += seeker->second.second + ", ";
00310     }
00311     out = cutlast(cutlast(out));
00312     out += "}";
00313     BasicTypes[name] = tmp;
00314     return out;
00315   }
00316   
00317   bool checkGenericExistence(string name, bool id)
00318   {
00319     for(unsigned long i = 0; i < Generics.size(); i++)
00320     {
00321       if(Generics[i].first == name)
00322       {
00323         if(Generics[i].second.id == id)
00324           return true;
00325       }
00326     }
00327     return false;
00328   }
00329   
00330   Generic writeGeneric(Form* in, bool type)
00331   {
00332     //0        1                    2       3        4
00333     //(generic [structure|function] [name] ([args]) [code*]
00334     Generic out;
00335     out.id = type;
00336     if(type == typeStructure)
00337     {
00338       /* Now we modify the code to make it all ready for specialization
00339        * We star off with:
00340        * (generic structure derp (a) (element a))
00341        * And we end up with:
00342        * (structure derp (element a))
00343        */
00344       validateStructure(in);
00345       string name = val(nth(in,2));
00346       Form* code = readString("(structure " + name + ")");
00347       code = append(code, cdr(cdr(cdr(cdr(in)))));
00348       out.code = code;
00349       for(unsigned long i = 2; i < length(code); i++)
00350       {
00351         Form* current_field = nth(code,i);
00352         cout << "current field: " << current_field << endl;
00353         if(islist(current_field))
00354         {
00355           if(length(current_field) != 2)
00356           {
00357             printf("ERROR: Structure fields must either be a (name type) pair or a single symbol in case of generic structures");
00358             Unwind();
00359           }
00360           else if(islist(car(current_field)))
00361           {
00362             printf("ERROR: Can't use a list as a field name.");
00363             Unwind();
00364           }
00365           else
00366           {
00367             string field_name = val(car(current_field));
00368             if(analyze(field_name) != Symbol)
00369             {
00370               printf("ERROR: Can't use a non-symbolic atom as a field name.");
00371               Unwind();
00372             }
00373           }
00374         }
00375         else
00376         {
00377           printf("ERROR: Structure fields must be lists, not atoms.");
00378           Unwind();
00379         }
00380       }
00381     }
00382     else if(type == typeFunction)
00383     {
00384       /* Now we modify the code to make it all ready for specialization
00385        * We star off with:
00386        * (generic function durp (a b c)
00387        *   (function a ((i64 n) (i64 m)) ...))
00388        * And we end up with:
00389        * (function durp a ((i64 n) (i64 m)) ...)
00390        */
00391       string name = val(nth(in,2));
00392       Form* code = readString("(" + val(car(nth(in,4))) + " " + name + ")");
00393       code = append(code,cdr(nth(in,4)));
00394       out.code = code;
00395     }
00396     Form* arglist = nth(in,3);
00397     if(length(arglist) == 0)
00398     {
00399       printf("ERROR: Wrong number of arguments.");
00400       Unwind();
00401     }
00402     if(islist(arglist))
00403     {
00404       for(long i = 0; i < length(arglist); i++)
00405       {
00406         if(isatom(nth(arglist,i)))
00407         {
00408           if(analyze(val(nth(arglist,i))) != Symbol)
00409           {
00410             printf("ERROR: Arguments must be symbolic atoms.");
00411             Unwind();
00412           }
00413           else
00414           {
00415             out.arguments.push_back(val(nth(arglist,i)));
00416           }
00417         }
00418         else
00419         {
00420           printf("ERROR: Arguments must be symbolic atoms, but a list was found.");
00421           Unwind();
00422         }
00423       }
00424     }
00425     else
00426     {
00427       printf("ERROR: Argument list is not a list.");
00428       Unwind();
00429     }
00430     return out;
00431   }

00433   void addGeneric(string name, Generic in)
00434   {
00435     Generics.push_back(pair<string,Generic>(name,in));
00436   }
00437   
00438   Generic addGenericMethod(string name, Form* in)
00439   {
00440     for(unsigned long i = 0; i < Generics.size(); i++)
00441     {
00442       if(Generics[i].first == name)
00443       {
00444         if(Generics[i].second.id == typeStructure);
00445         {
00446           Form* code = readString("(" + val(car(nth(in,5))) + " " + val(nth(in,2)) + ")");
00447           code = append(code,cdr(nth(in,5)));
00448           Generics[i].second.methods.push_back(code);
00449           return Generics[i].second;
00450         }
00451       }
00452     }
00453   }
00454   
00455   Generic makeGeneric(Form* in)
00456   {
00457     if(length(in) < 4)
00458     {
00459       printf("ERROR: Wrong number of arguments.");
00460       Unwind();
00461     }
00462     if(isatom(nth(in,1)))
00463     {
00464       string text = val(nth(in,1));
00465       if(analyze(text) != Symbol)
00466       {
00467         printf("ERROR: The first argument to (generic) must be either 'function' or 'structure'.");
00468         Unwind();
00469       }
00470       else
00471       {
00472         Generic out;
00473         string name = val(nth(in,2));
00474         if(analyze(name) != Symbol)
00475         {
00476           printf("ERROR: The name of the generic must be a symbolic atom.");
00477           Unwind();
00478         }
00479         if(text == "structure")
00480         {
00481           out = writeGeneric(in,typeStructure);
00482           if(checkGenericExistence(name,typeStructure))
00483           {
00484             printf("ERROR: Generic already exists.");
00485             Unwind();
00486           }
00487           addGeneric(name,out);
00488           return out;
00489         }
00490         else if(text == "function")
00491         {
00492           out = writeGeneric(in,typeFunction);
00493           if(checkGenericExistence(name,typeFunction))
00494           {
00495             printf("ERROR: Generic already exists.");
00496             Unwind();
00497           }
00498           addGeneric(name,out);
00499           return out;
00500         }
00501         else if(text == "method")
00502         {
00503           if(isatom(nth(in,2)))
00504           {
00505             if(analyze(val(nth(in,2))) == Symbol)
00506             {
00507               if(isatom(nth(in,3)))
00508               {
00509                 if(val(nth(in,3)) == "of")
00510                 {
00511                   if(isatom(nth(in,4)))
00512                   {
00513                     if(analyze(val(nth(in,4))) == Symbol)
00514                     {
00515                       string generic_name = val(nth(in,4));
00516                       if(!checkGenericExistence(generic_name,typeStructure))
00517                       {
00518                         printf("ERROR: The Generic for this method doesn't exist.");
00519                         Unwind();
00520                       }
00521                       else
00522                       {
00523                         return addGenericMethod(generic_name,in);
00524                       }
00525                     }
00526                     else
00527                     {
00528                       printf("ERROR:");
00529                       Unwind();
00530                     }
00531                   }
00532                   else
00533                   {
00534                     printf("ERROR:");
00535                     Unwind();
00536                   }
00537                 }
00538                 else
00539                 {
00540                   printf("ERROR:");
00541                   Unwind();
00542                 }
00543               }
00544               printf("ERROR:");
00545               Unwind();
00546             }
00547             printf("ERROR:");
00548             Unwind();
00549           }
00550           printf("ERROR:");
00551           Unwind();
00552         }
00553         else
00554         {
00555           printf("ERROR: The second argument when making a generic is either 'function' or 'structure'. Some other text was received.");
00556           Unwind();
00557         }
00558       }
00559     }
00560     else
00561     {
00562       printf("ERROR: The first argument to (generic) must be either 'function' or 'structure', but a list was found.");
00563       Unwind();
00564     }
00565   }
00566   
00567   string genericInterface(Form* form)
00568   {
00569     Generic tmp = makeGeneric(form);
00570     if(val(nth(form,1)) != "method")
00571       Generics.push_back(pair<string,Generic>(val(nth(form,2)),tmp));
00572     return "";
00573   }

00575   void init_types()
00576   {
00577     CoreTypes;
00578     CoreTypes.push_back("half");
00579     CoreTypes.push_back("float");
00580     CoreTypes.push_back("double");
00581     CoreTypes.push_back("x86_fp80");
00582     CoreTypes.push_back("fp128");
00583     CoreTypes.push_back("ppc_fp128");
00584   }
